description: Philip Lutzenkirchen died in June 2014 in a one-vehicle accident in LaGrange as a passenger in a car driven by a friend who also died.
title: Photos: Philip Lutzenkirchen on the field
title_page: Photos: Philip Lutzenkirchen on the field
text:
1 / 18
Kevin C. Cox Philip Lutzenkirchen #43 of the Auburn Tigers celebrate after pulling in this go-ahead touchdown reception against the South Carolina Gamecocks at Jordan-Hare Stadium on September 25, 2010 in Auburn, Alabama. (Photo by Kevin C. Cox/Getty Images) Lutzenkirchen died in multiple-fatality crash in the early morning hours of Sunday, June 29, 2014. He was ejected from the vehicle. He was 23 years old at the time of his death.
2 / 18
Courtesy of Rob Saye Lutzenkirchen was a teammate and close friend of Georgia quarterback Hutson Mason from their days at Lassiter High School in Marietta. Lutzenkirchen died at the age of 23 in a multiple-fatality accident during the early morning hours of Sunday, June 29, 2014.
3 / 18
Todd R. McQueen Philip Lutzenkirchen died in multiple-fatality crash in the early morning hours of Sunday, June 29, 2014. The crash was near LaGrange, Ga. He was 23. Here, Phillip Lutzenkirchen (13) celebrates a first quarter touchdown with Lassiter High School teammate Griffin Lamie (11). Todd R. McQueen / Special
4 / 18
Jason Getz Wesleyan's Ian Davis (5) steals second base in a game vs. Greater Atlanta Christian School on March 25, 2008, in Norcross. (Jason Getz / AJC) Davis was the driver of a vehicle in a multiple-fatality crash in the early morning hours of June 29, 2014. The vehicle failed to stop at a stop sign and traveled approximately 451 feet before overturning several times in a church yard, according to Georgia State Patrol. Davis and former Auburn Tigers tight end Philip Lutzenkirchen died in the crash.
5 / 18
Kevin C. Cox Philip Lutzenkirchen #43 of the Auburn Tigers pulls in this go-ahead touchdown reception against the South Carolina Gamecocks at Jordan-Hare Stadium on September 25, 2010 in Auburn, Alabama. (Photo by Kevin C. Cox/Getty Images) Lutzenkirchen died in multiple-fatality crash in the early morning hours of Sunday, June 29, 2014. He was ejected from the vehicle. He was 23 years old at the time of his death.
6 / 18
Kevin C. Cox Philip Lutzenkirchen #43 of the Auburn Tigers against the LSU Tigers at Jordan-Hare Stadium on October 23, 2010 in Auburn, Alabama. (Photo by Kevin C. Cox/Getty Images) Lutzenkirchen died in multiple-fatality crash in the early morning hours of Sunday, June 29, 2014. He was 23.
7 / 18
Butch Dill Tight end Philip Lutzenkirchen #43 of the Auburn Tigers celebrates after catching a pass for a touchdown against the Mississippi State Bulldogs in the third quarter on September 10, 2011 at Jordan-Hare Stadium in Auburn, Alabama. (Photo by Butch Dill/Getty Images)
8 / 18
Butch Dill Tight end Philip Lutzenkirchen #43 and running back Onterio McCalebb #23 of the Auburn Tigers celebrate their 41-34 win over Mississippi State with the fans after the game on September 10, 2011 at Jordan-Hare Stadium in Auburn, Alabama. (Photo by Butch Dill/Getty Images) Lutzenkirchen died in multiple-fatality crash in the early morning hours of Sunday, June 29, 2014.
9 / 18
Kevin C. Cox Philip Lutzenkirchen, #43, of the Auburn Tigers reacts after pulling in a touchdown reception against the Alabama Crimson Tide at Bryant-Denny Stadium on November 26, 2010 in Tuscaloosa, Alabama. (Photo by Kevin C. Cox/Getty Images) Lutzenkirchen died in multiple-fatality crash in the early morning hours of Sunday, June 29, 2014. He was ejected from the vehicle.
10 / 18
Streeter Lecka Philip Lutzenkirchen #43 of the Auburn Tigers fumbles the ball and then picks it up for the game winning touchdown as Reginald Bowens #32 of the South Carolina Gamecocks tries to make the stop during their game at Williams-Brice Stadium on October 1, 2011 in Columbia, South Carolina. (Photo by Streeter Lecka/Getty Images) Lutzenkirchen died in multiple-fatality crash in the early morning hours of Sunday, June 29, 2014.
11 / 18
Streeter Lecka Philip Lutzenkirchen #43 of the Auburn Tigers fumbles the ball and then picks it up for the game-winning touchdown as Reginald Bowens #32 of the South Carolina Gamecocks tries to make the stop during their game at Williams-Brice Stadium on October 1, 2011 in Columbia, South Carolina. (Photo by Streeter Lecka/Getty Images) Lutzenkirchen died in multiple-fatality crash in the early morning hours of Sunday, June 29, 2014. He was ejected from the vehicle.
12 / 18
Streeter Lecka Philip Lutzenkirchen #43 of the Auburn Tigers celebrates with teammates after making the game winning touchdown against the South Carolina Gamecocks during their game at Williams-Brice Stadium on October 1, 2011 in Columbia, South Carolina. (Photo by Streeter Lecka/Getty Images)
13 / 18
Streeter Lecka Philip Lutzenkirchen, #43, of the Auburn Tigers during their game against the Clemson Tigers at Memorial Stadium on September 17, 2011 in Clemson, South Carolina. (Photo by Streeter Lecka/Getty Images)
14 / 18
Kevin C. Cox Philip Lutzenkirchen #43 of the Auburn Tigers celebrates his touchdown against the Georgia Bulldogs at Sanford Stadium on November 12, 2011 in Athens, Georgia. (Photo by Kevin C. Cox/Getty Images)
15 / 18
Butch Dill Tight end Philip Lutzenkirchen #43 of the Auburn Tigers is checked out on the sidelines after being helped off the field in the fourth quarter of a NCAA college football game against the Mississippi State Bulldogs on September 8, 2012 at Davis Wade Stadium in Starkville, Mississippi. (Photo by Butch Dill/Getty Images) Philip Lutzenkirchen died in multiple-fatality crash in the early morning hours of Sunday, June 29, 2014.

Butch Dill Tight end Philip Lutzenkirchen #43 of the Auburn Tigers is checked out on the sidelines after being helped off the field in the fourth quarter of a NCAA college football game against the Mississippi State Bulldogs on September 8, 2012 at Davis Wade Stadium in Starkville, Mississippi. (Photo by Butch Dill/Getty Images) Philip Lutzenkirchen died in multiple-fatality crash in the early morning hours of Sunday, June 29, 2014. The crash was near LaGrange, Ga. He was 23.

Butch Dill Auburn tight end Philip Lutzenkirchen (43) tries to hurdle Louisiana Monroe cornerback Otis Peterson (9) during an NCAA college football game on Saturday, Oct. 2, 2010, in Auburn, Ala. (AP Photo/Butch Dill)
